content.description: Start left of the first bolt and traverse right using the lip of the small roof, pass the first bolt and continue right to gain the fin/ramp of Numero Uno and the second bolt.  Delicate stemming will get you to the top of the bulge and the third bolt, then easier climbing to the top.
content.location: In between Tonga and Numero Uno, the start is near a small boulder.

content.description: More sustained warm-up climbing than Econoline (that sports a single tricky move towards the top).
content.location: First/last line in the Numero Uno Sector. Look to the right from Demon in My Semen (Train in Vain Sector) about 20 feet.

content.description: Start right of T Bag. Climb interesting corners to roof with drill hole. Climb up the left dihedral to first high bolt and follow the rest to the top. The Anchors are about 10' above last bolt.
content.protection:
The route has now been bolted. 4 Bolts and 2 bolt anchor (installed 10/19/2019).

 There is a possibility to add a few trad pieces between the bolts.

 You can still trad lead at R-X risk factor. The major risk is that the rock won't hold your gear when arresting a fall.

content.description: Climb a rib of partially broken rock to the first bolt at a left-facing corner.  Continue past one more bolt, then go right to surmount the corner.  Climb easily to a small rooflet and the third bolt, then surmount the rooflet and climb the nice finger crack up a slab to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of Ellie's Belly, at a left facing corner next to a broken area with a tree ledge at 30 feet.  The prominent finger crack of this route is visible 30 feet up.

content.description: Climb Tonga to 3rd bolt (5.9).   Break left up to head wall.    Climb slightly overhung face (5.11) to shallow drill hole to Anchors
content.protection: recently equipped with bolts and anchors. To avoid falling on the rope, use a single locker on the first bolt on the head wall.

content.description:
Left past a little roof to start, followed by as many slabs as you feel like. Stop at the first anchors, or continue up more low angle rock to Wild Palms' anchors higher up.

 Upper anchor is now equipped with drop ins (as of 2 Mar 2020)
content.protection:
Three stainless steel bolts to a pair of rap rings/anchors. Bolts protect the roof section nicely with one right under, and another right above.  

  Two more bolts and a second anchor (from Wild Palms to the right) could be followed above to extend the route.

content.description: Start on steep crack 10' right of Numero Uno.   Follow crack unto its end at the last bolt on Numero Uno.
content.location: Between Numero Uno and T Bag.

climbs.name: Numero Uno
climbs.fa: Cameron Hörst, Jonathan Hörst, Eric Hörst

content.description: Start laybacking/stemming your way through the corner, then up to a good rest then easy face climbing to the anchors.
content.location: 1st bolted line you come to in the Numero Uno sector.

climbs.name: The Other Crack by Numero Uno

content.description: Climb crack just left of T Bag.   End on Numero Uno Anchors
Start right of Warthogs Can't Fly.   Move up corners to bulge.

climbs.name: Ellie's Belly
climbs.fa: Dave Rosso, Rob Goldberg, and Alan Margolie, Nov 2017

content.description:
Two weeks ago we put in a new route at Safe Harbor, PA. We call it, in the spirit of Lynn's Chin, "Ellie's Belly."  

  Six clips, it climbs left facing corners and finishes on a low angle slab. We believe it rates 5.6 or 5.7. I see it as a warm up for other climbs in the area, a pleasant beginner's route, and a safe climb for novice leaders.  

  "We" is Dave Rosso, Rob Goldberg, and Alan Margolies -- longtime Safe Harbor climbers.
content.location: It is located to the right of "Black is Power," and left of the "Tradatrocity" block.

content.description: Up the first three bolts of a face (shared with Bat Crack), then up the steep arete on the right.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Anchor is shared with Bat Crack.
content.location: Highest routes on the Numero Uno Sector.

content.description: Crux is between bolts 1-2. Higher sections look blank but there is actually more there.
content.protection: Five bolts, plus anchors (drop ins added 2 March 2020) First bolt is a little high.
content.location: Look for the bolts lines on the obvious slab feature to the right of Demon in my Semen.

content.description: Up blocky face to stance, then head straight up the thin crack (fingerjams) on the overhanging face.
The routes near the short corner route Numero Uno (5.10c) in Safe Harbor South.
